CatDescriptText: Mr. Stephen Kosko, 207 Third Street, Neville Island, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that the average family spends too much time watching television.  And this is bad, because members of the family do not get out as often as they should to participate in programs of the PTA, civil defense, and other social and civic meetings."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Stephen Kosko, wearing patterned necktie and trench coat, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of Jenkins Arcade, with pedestrians, automobiles, and May Building sign reading Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
